channel.title: Algebra II
channel.description:
Can anybody help me factor this polynomial?
12x[sup]2[/sup]-6x-126
And this one too:
x[sup]2[/sup]-32x-10

item.title: Algebra II
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:4, topic:164410”]Second one:

x[sup]2[/sup]-32x-10

  1. Move constants right: x[sup]2[/sup] - 32x = 10
  2. Find missing square: x[sup]2[/sup] - 32x + 256 = 10 + 256
  3. Simplify: (x - 16)2 = 266
  4. Squareroot each side: x - 16 = ± sqrt(266)
  5. Simplify: x = 16 ± sqrt(266)

Second one:

12x[sup]2[/sup]-6x-126

  1. Divide both sides by 12 (to get x[sup]2[/sup] alone): x[sup]2[/sup] - 0.5x - 10.5
  2. Move constant to the right: x[sup]2[/sup] - 0.5x = 10.5
  3. Find the missing sqare: x[sup]2[/sup] - 0.5x + 0.0625 = 10.5 + 0.0625
  4. Simplify: (x - 0.25)2 = 10.5625
  5. Sqareroot each side: x - 0.25 = ± sqrt(10.5625)
  6. Simplify: x = 0.25 ± sqrt(10.5625)[/quote]

CORRECT. This topic is now done! Nice Taharok.

Read full topic

item.title: Algebra II
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Second one:

x[sup]2[/sup]-32x-10

  1. Move constants right: x[sup]2[/sup] - 32x = 10
  2. Find missing square: x[sup]2[/sup] - 32x + 256 = 10 + 256
  3. Simplify: (x - 16)2 = 266
  4. Squareroot each side: x - 16 = ± sqrt(266)
  5. Simplify: x = 16 ± sqrt(266)

Second one:

12x[sup]2[/sup]-6x-126

  1. Divide both sides by 12 (to get x[sup]2[/sup] alone): x[sup]2[/sup] - 0.5x - 10.5
  2. Move constant to the right: x[sup]2[/sup] - 0.5x = 10.5
  3. Find the missing sqare: x[sup]2[/sup] - 0.5x + 0.0625 = 10.5 + 0.0625
  4. Simplify: (x - 0.25)2 = 10.5625
  5. Sqareroot each side: x - 0.25 = ± sqrt(10.5625)
  6. Simplify: x = 0.25 ± sqrt(10.5625)

Read full topic

item.title: Algebra II
item.dc:creator: @Hyjall Hyjall
item.description:
@Hyjall wrote:

[quote=“Chimaera God, post:1, topic:164410”]Can anybody help me factor this polynomial?

12x[sup]2[/sup]-6x-126

And this one too:

x[sup]2[/sup]-32x-10[/quote]

If you mean solve them then:

12x[sup]2[/sup]-6x-126

D=-6[sup]2[/sup]-412-126 = 6084

6-sqrt(6084) or 6+sqrt(6084)

212 212

x = -3 x=3.5

cba to write all of the second down but in short

D=1064

32-sqrt(D)

2

x= 1/3 (ish)

or

32+sqrt(D)

2

x= 33.1/3 ish

EDIT: well didn’t read the question thoroughly, >:. Solved equatations stay so it doesn’t totally look like spam.

Read full topic
